overview:
Ryan is currently an MBA Candidate in the Class of 2012 at The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania where he is double majoring in Finance and Entrepreneurial Management. He is the Co-Founder of PalmLing.com, an innovative resource designed to promote global travel and cultural exploration by providing international travelers with phone-based access to human translators.

Prior to enrolling at Wharton, Ryan was a financial analyst at Goldman Sachs in New York City. Ryan joined Goldman Sachs in 2006 in the firm’s Special Situations Group where he focused on middle market private equity transactions and the operational management of portfolio companies. Prior to joining the private equity business, Ryan worked on structured transactions and alternative energy investing.

In 2006, Ryan also founded QuietEmber.com, a web-based resource designed to support the college athletic recruiting needs of student-athletes and college coaches.

Ryan is a triathlete and a recent Ironman triathlon finisher. Ryan enjoys investing in and launching new business ventures, trading stocks and foreign exchange and investing in real estate.
